page.title: 07WILD ANIMALS
page.content: The most common animals in our area are mice rabbits and hares. Rabbits live in burrows underground, epecially in the moorland areas close to Ludworth. The rabbit population is increasing at the moment. Badgers also live in this area, a bager's home is called a sett. Badgers hunt mainly at night, and are difficult to see in daylight. Many of the animals of this area hibernate in the winter, especially the rodents. The small mammals of the area are natural prey for the many birds of prey which live here; you can see kestrels, crows, and barn owls.
